ovdesc.p: This application defines the tabs that are displayed on a tabbed screen.
A tabbed screen may be used to simply display separate enquiries/contracts in separate tabs as a way of saving space on a T24 Browser screen.

However, tabbed screens can be used to link enquiries and contracts together as a form of workflow between tabs. Data from one tab can be used in the next tab. For example, once a user has selected a Customer in one tab they can look at the accounts for that Customer in the next tab.

desc.p: The title of the current tab.
The ID of the Tabbed Screen.
The title of the Tabbed Screen.
What is run to display the content.
Any arguments for the value defined in SOURCE.
For example, if the CONTENT.TYPE is a UTILITY then the SOURCE field contains the routine name (e.g. OS.NEW.USER) and the SOURCE.ARGS field contains the argumaents to the routine (e.g. MENU).
The type of content in the current tab.
COS - a Composite Screen defined by EB.COMPSOITE.SCREEN
ENQ - an Enquiry defined by ENQUIRY
MENU - a Menu defined by HELPTEXT.MAINMENU
TXN - an Contract screen of a T24 Application
URL - a URL to an internal/external web site
UTILITY - a T24 Utility Routine that returns XMl in a certain format
The name of a field on the current tabs enquiry/contract whose contents will be copied over to the SELECT.TO field of another tab.
The destination field of an enquiry/contract used when copying content from the SELECT.FROM field.
